ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.2_0: At that time the lay followers were going to the monastery to listen to the Teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.3_0: When the instruction was over, the senior monks went to their own dwellings,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.4_0: but the newly ordained monks lay down right there in the assembly hall together with the lay followers—absentminded, heedless, naked, muttering, and snoring.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.5_0: Those lay followers then complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.6_0: “How can the venerables lay down absentminded, heedless, naked, muttering, and snoring?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.7_0: The monks heard the complaints of those lay followers,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.8_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.9_0: “How can those monks lay down in the same sleeping place as people who are not fully ordained?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.10_0: After rebuking those newly ordained monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.11_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.14_0: “... How can those foolish men do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.15_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.16_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.17.1_0: ‘If a monk lay down in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.18_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.1_0: After staying at Āḷavī for as long as he wanted, the Buddha set out wandering toward Kosambī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.2_1: he stayed in the Bhagu Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.3_0: Just then the monks said to Venerable Rāhula,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.4_0: “Rāhula, the Buddha has laid down a training rule that we can’t lay down in the same sleeping place as a person who’s not fully ordained.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.7_0: Then, after rising early in the morning, the Buddha went to the hut in the morning.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.7_1: and after going, I released my robe,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.12_0: Rāhula told the Buddha what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.13_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.14_0: “Monks, I allow you to lay down in the same sleeping place as a person who isn’t fully ordained for two or three nights.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.15_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.16.1_0: ‘If a monk lay down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.5_0: A person who is not fully ordained:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.6_0: anyone except a fully ordained monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.7_0: more than two or three nights:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.8_0: in excess of two or three nights.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.12_0: all envy desires, etc., which are suitable for marriage .
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.13_0: Lays down in the same sleeping place:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.14_0: at dawn on the fourth day: if he lies down when the person who is not fully ordained is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.15_0: if the person who is not fully ordained lies down when he is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.16_0: if they both lie down together, he commits an offense entailing confession;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.17_0: every time they get up and then lie down again, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.1_0: If someone is not fully ordained, and the monk does not perceive him as such, and he lays down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.2_0: If someone is not fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, and he lays down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.3_0: If someone is not fully ordained, but the monk perceives him as such, and he lays down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.4_0: If it is half-roofed and half-walled, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.5_0: If someone is fully ordained, but the monk does not perceive him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.6_0: If the person is fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.7_0: If the person is fully ordained, and the monk perceives them such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.2_0: if he stays for two or three nights;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.3_0: if he stays together for less than two or three nights;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.4_0: if he stays for two nights, then leaves before dawn on the third night, and then stays again;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.7_0: if it is mostly not walled;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.8_0: if it is mostly not walled;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.9_0: if the monk sits when the person who is not fully ordained is lying down;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.10_0: if the person who is not fully ordained sits when the monk is lying down;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.13_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.14_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on the same sleeping place, is finished.
